title: 114_hr1697
content: The Act is titled the "Electric Charging And Refueling Act" or the "E-Car Act." It amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend and modify the credit for electric car recharging property. The "Electric Charging And Refueling Act" allows a 50% tax credit for qualified electric vehicle recharging property placed in service during the taxable year. The credit is limited to $100,000 or $10,000 multiplied by the number of devices placed in service, with a maximum of $2,000 in other cases. The term 'qualified electric vehicle recharging property' refers to property used for recharging or refueling electric vehicles, with specific criteria such as being depreciable, installed by the taxpayer, and providing electricity for recharging. The term 'device' is defined as an individual item. The term 'device' refers to an individual item of property that functions to recharge one vehicle at a time. The credit allowed for electric vehicle recharging property is subject to specific rules regarding depreciation and application with other credits. The credit for electric vehicle recharging property is subject to specific rules regarding the maximum allowable amount, reduction in basis of property, and special rules for property used by tax-exempt entities. The credit for electric vehicle recharging property is subject to specific rules regarding the maximum allowable amount, reduction in basis of property, and special rules for property used by tax-exempt entities. Property used outside the United States or if the taxpayer elects not to take the credit, no credit shall be allowed. Recapture rules similar to section 179A(e)(4) apply. The credit for electric vehicle recharging property is subject to specific rules, including recapture rules similar to section 179A(e)(4). Qualified electric vehicle recharging property can be jointly owned and still qualify for the credit. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 30D(c)(2)(B) of the Code. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2013, with a specific provision for hydrogen refueling property placed in service after December 31, 2014.
